content.question: An object moves in the xy-plane so that its position at any time t is given by the parametric equations x(t) = t3 − 3t2 + 2 and <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </math>. What is the rate of change of y with respect to x when t = 3 ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
